metadata.title: Thursday, 13th November, 2014
metadata.session: FOURTH SESSION OF THE ELEVENTH ASSEMBLY

questions.minister: Minister of Transport, Works, Supply and Communication
parts: (a)    when the Government will come up with a comprehensive plan for the construction of feeder and access roads in rural areas; and
(b)    whether the Government has ever carried out an analysis of the Link Zambia 8000 Project and the construction of rural roads in order to appreciate the social and economic linkages.

questions.minister: Minister of Local Government and Housing
parts: (a)    whether the Government has any plans to open up new burial sites in Lusaka in view of the shortage of burial space at the existing cemeteries;
(b)    if so, where the new sites will be located; and
(c)    what has caused the delay in opening up new sites.
(a)    how much bed space was in the hospitality industry as of 31st December, 2013;
(b)    what steps have been taken to increase the bed space; and
(c)    what the room occupancy rates were as of 31st December, 2013.

questions.minister: Minister of Transport, Works, Supply and Communication when the bridge across Kasanjiku River in Chief Ntambu’s area in Mwinilunga Parliamentary Constituency will be rehabilitated.
Minister of Home Affairs when ambulances will be procured for Mukobeko Maximum Prison and other prisons country-wide.
questions.question_text: ORDER OF THE DAY 1    Supply - Motion (10th October) - Resumption of Debate
